You don't say what version you're trying to build, but it sounds similar 
  to the issue recently discussed in this thread, which has some tips 
for working around the problem:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/5630

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

neil_daswani wrote:
> Dear Heretrix Experts,
> 
> I am a Heretrix newbie-- I downloaded Heretrix and maven, but when I
> try building, I receive the following error:
> 
> $ maven dist
> 
> [ ... ]
> 
> Trying to get missing dependencies (and updated snapshots) required by
> Maven Tasklist Plug-in:
> - Attempting to download vdoclet:qdox:current:jar from
> http://repo1.maven.org/maven
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>>> Unable to obtain goal [dist:prepare-bin-filesystem]
>>> The build cannot continue because of the following unsatisfied
> dependency:
> - vdoclet:qdox:current:jar
> 
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> BUILD FAILED
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Total time   : 1 minutes 28 seconds 
> Finished at  : Saturday, February 7, 2009 4:57:38 PM EST
> Final Memory : 7M/32M
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> 
> The build successfully gets through all the junit tests from what I
> can tell, but then dies with the above error message.
> 
> I was able to locate qdox-current.jar at
> http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/vdoclet/qdox/current/ (which seems to be
> its new location), and I saved that jar into maven's lib dir, but I
> still get the above build error.
> 
> Any thoughts on what I might be doing wrong?  I am hoping it is
> something obvious!
> 
> Thanks!
> 
> -- Neil
>
